content:
I think I messed up. I needed to un-vote a negative vote I submitted. Perhaps I missed an un-vote workflow option, but I was able to delete the link to the issue, but now I am still left with my negative ballot comment. It is empty, and I can't seem to find a way to get rid of it? Can someone help?
https://jira.hl7.org/browse/BALLOT-17309
Ultimately, I would like to get back to a point where I can link my vote to someone else's vote.
Thanks for the help

Oooh. You should definitely never delete ballot links. If you'd left it, you'd have an 'un-vote' option (possibly under workflow). I've gone and deleted your ballot vote issue. That didn't trigger an update of your overall vote - try voting negative again, then un-voting...
Out of curiosity - how did you delete the link?
I viewed the issue (the FHIR-XXXXX) issue, and could see my Ballot comment as a link. There is an option to delete the link (an X shows up on the right)

I was able to link my vote now (the Vote Same As option).
Thanks @Lloyd McKenzie

Regarding how I did it, when viewing the issue here, my BALLOT-ZZZZZ number showed up under 'Issue Links -> is voted on by' and I don't know whether it would let me know, but I also see the X to delete that is there now that isn't even mine:
image.png

Sigh. I think the issue is that when you initiate the workflow, it uses your credentials to do the deletion - and that's actually necessary. I'll add this to my list of things to try to figure out how to lock down.

Well, @Kevin Power I feel like I am in good company now. I did the exact.same.thing. I deleted the link. I don't suppose I can sweet talk @Lloyd McKenzie into working his magic on my now orphaned https://jira.hl7.org/browse/BALLOT-17263
